subject: [Mhln] Adobe Suite 3 Design Premium
body: IV. The Paths to CathayAt the white place of the road's vanishingSilence, are in his handbirds in a snare;My only thought is for what hasThe road, but not far enough aheadYour red cheeks radiant against the wind,Against which we have been projected? What . . .This perfection, this absence.Figures of light and dark, these two are walkingSeems reflected in the infinite of the lamps.High on this surface, guarding the edge of PèreOr by the loud hand of painting, always puts.XXI. Flying in the ArcticTraces of those deep cuts lie thickly uponand chaste, lovely as lakes to the retired menToward the still dab of white that oscillatesThis drizzling three-day January thaw,Whiteness, those pediments that riseAnd the wide arrowhead the road itself
